intro: Simarouba berteroana, commonly known as the yellow mangle or yellow mangrove, is a tropical tree native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It is a member of the Simarouba genus within the family Meliaceae, characterized by its aromatic wood and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has compound leaves with alternate arrangement and produces small, yellowish-green fruits that contain winged seeds. It thrives in coastal and swampy areas, often forming dense thickets in brackish water environments. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat for various wildlife species and contributing to soil stabilization in wetland ecosystems.
